intro: Leucopogon exolasius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and evergreens. The plant typically grows in acidic, sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and maritime forests. Its small, white or pinkish flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are narrow, leathery, and evergreen, contributing to its adaptability in harsh environments.
